DSR_BCR1.description: DMA Status Register / Byte Count Register

SAR.description: Each SAR contains the byte address used by the DMA controller to read data

DAR.description: Each DAR contains the byte address used by the DMA controller to write data

BCR.description: This field contains the number of bytes yet to be transferred for a given block

EINT.description: Enable Interrupt on Completion of Transfer

DATA0.description: When the DAC buffer is not enabled, DATA[11:0] controls the output voltage based on the following formula: V out = V in * (1 + DACDAT0[11:0])/4096 When the DAC buffer is enabled, DATA is mapped to the 16-word buffer

DATA1.description: When the DAC Buffer is not enabled, DATA[11:0] controls the output voltage based on the following formula

DACBFRPBF.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Position Flag

DACBFRPTF.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Position Flag

DACBBIEN.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Flag Interrupt Enable

DACBTIEN.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Flag Interrupt Enable

GENCS.description: TSI General Control and Status Register

MODE.description: TSI analog modes setup and status bits.

USBVSTBY.description: USB voltage regulator in standby mode during VLPR and VLPW modes

USBSSTBY.description: USB voltage regulator in standby mode during Stop, VLPS, LLS and VLLS modes.

URWE.description: USB voltage regulator enable write enable

UVSWE.description: USB voltage regulator VLP standby write enable

USSWE.description: USB voltage regulator stop standby write enable

TPM1CH0SRC.description: TPM1 channel 0 input capture source select

TPM2CH0SRC.description: TPM2 Channel 0 Input Capture Source Select

MAXADDR1.description: This field concatenated with leading zeros plus the value of the MAXADDR1 field indicates the first invalid address of the second program flash block (flash block 1)

FDCIEN.description: LCD Fault Detection Complete Interrupt Enable

CPSEL.description: Charge Pump or Resistor Bias Select

WF0.description: Controls segments or phases connected to LCD_P0 as described above for WF3.

WF1.description: Controls segments or phases connected to LCD_P1 as described above for WF3.

WF2.description: Controls segments or phases connected to LCD_P2 as described above for WF3.

WF3.description: Segment-on front plane operation - Each bit turns on or off the segments associated with LCD_P3 in the following pattern: HGFEDCBA (most significant bit controls segment H and least significant bit controls segment A)

WF4.description: Controls segments or phases connected to LCD_P4 as described above for WF3TO0[WF3].

ATCVH.description: MCG Auto Trim Compare Value High Register

ATCVL.description: MCG Auto Trim Compare Value Low Register

FCFTRIM.description: Fast Internal Reference Clock Fine Trim

SCTRIM.description: Slow Internal Reference Clock Trim Setting

SCFTRIM.description: Slow Internal Reference Clock Fine Trim

FCTRIM.description: Fast Internal Reference Clock Trim Setting

DMX32.description: DCO Maximum Frequency with 32.768 kHz Reference

LOLRE.description: PLL Loss of Lock Reset Enable

FLT.description: I2C Programmable Input Glitch Filter register

SMB.description: I2C SMBus Control and Status register

SLTH.description: I2C SCL Low Timeout Register High

SLTL.description: I2C SCL Low Timeout Register Low

SSIE.description: I2C Bus Stop or Start Interrupt Enable

SSLT.description: Most significant byte of SCL low timeout value that determines the timeout period of SCL low.
Least significant byte of SCL low timeout value that determines the timeout period of SCL low.

RXEDGIE.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable (for RXEDGIF)

LBKDIE.description: LIN Break Detect Interrupt Enable (for LBKDIF)

ILIE.description: Idle Line Interrupt Enable for IDLE

TCIE.description: Transmission Complete Interrupt Enable for TC

RXEDGIF.description: UART_RX Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

TXDIR.description: UART_TX Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

R0T0.description: Read receive data buffer 0 or write transmit data buffer 0.

R1T1.description: Read receive data buffer 1 or write transmit data buffer 1.

R2T2.description: Read receive data buffer 2 or write transmit data buffer 2.

R3T3.description: Read receive data buffer 3 or write transmit data buffer 3.

R4T4.description: Read receive data buffer 4 or write transmit data buffer 4.

R5T5.description: Read receive data buffer 5 or write transmit data buffer 5.

R6T6.description: Read receive data buffer 6 or write transmit data buffer 6.

R7T7.description: Read receive data buffer 7 or write transmit data buffer 7.

NID.description: Ones complement of peripheral identification bits.

IEHOST.description: When this bit is set, the USB peripheral is operating in host mode.

AVBUSCHG.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on an A device.

B_SESS_CHG.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on a B device.

SESSVLDCHG.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected indicating a session valid or a session no longer valid

LINE_STATE_CHG.description: This bit is set when the USB line state changes

ONEMSEC.description: This bit is set when the 1 millisecond timer expires

IDCHG.description: This bit is set when a change in the ID Signal from the USB connector is sensed.

LINESTATESTABLE.description: Indicates that the internal signals that control the LINE_STATE_CHG field of OTGISTAT are stable for at least 1 millisecond

ONEMSECEN.description: This bit is reserved for the 1ms count, but it is not useful to software.

ID.description: Indicates the current state of the ID pin on the USB connector

DMLOW.description: D- Data Line pull-down resistor enable

DPLOW.description: D+ Data Line pull-down resistor enable

DPHIGH.description: D+ Data Line pullup resistor enable

USBRST.description: This bit is set when the USB Module has decoded a valid USB reset

ERROR.description: This bit is set when any of the error conditions within Error Interrupt Status (ERRSTAT) register occur

SOFTOK.description: This bit is set when the USB Module receives a Start Of Frame (SOF) token

TOKDNE.description: This bit is set when the current token being processed has completed

SLEEP.description: This bit is set when the USB Module detects a constant idle on the USB bus for 3 ms

RESUME.description: This bit is set depending upon the DP/DM signals, and can be used to signal remote wake-up signaling on the USB bus

PIDERR.description: This bit is set when the PID check field fails.

CRC5EOF.description: This error interrupt has two functions

CRC16.description: This bit is set when a data packet is rejected due to a CRC16 error.

DFN8.description: This bit is set if the data field received was not 8 bits in length

BTOERR.description: This bit is set when a bus turnaround timeout error occurs

DMAERR.description: This bit is set if the USB Module has requested a DMA access to read a new BDT but has not been given the bus before it needs to receive or transmit data

BTSERR.description: This bit is set when a bit stuff error is detected

ODD.description: This bit is set if the last buffer descriptor updated was in the odd bank of the BDT.

ENDP.description: This four-bit field encodes the endpoint address that received or transmitted the previous token

ODDRST.description: Setting this bit to 1 resets all the BDT ODD ping/pong fields to 0, which then specifies the EVEN BDT bank

RESUME.description: When set to 1 this bit enables the USB Module to execute resume signaling

HOSTMODEEN.description: When set to 1, this bit enables the USB Module to operate in Host mode

RESET.description: Setting this bit enables the USB Module to generate USB reset signaling

TXSUSPENDTOKENBUSY.description: In Host mode, TOKEN_BUSY is set when the USB module is busy executing a USB token

SE0.description: Live USB Single Ended Zero signal

JSTATE.description: Live USB differential receiver JSTATE signal

BDTBA.description: Provides address bits 15 through 9 of the BDT base address.

FRM.description: This 8-bit field and the 3-bit field in the Frame Number Register High are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory
This 3-bit field and the 8-bit field in the Frame Number Register Low are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory

TOKENENDPT.description: Holds the Endpoint address for the token command

TOKENPID.description: Contains the token type executed by the USB module.

CNT.description: Represents the SOF count threshold in byte times.

BDTBA.description: Provides address bits 23 through 16 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory
Provides address bits 31 through 24 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory

EPHSHK.description: When set this bit enables an endpoint to perform handshaking during a transaction to this endpoint

EPSTALL.description: When set this bit indicates that the endpoint is called

EPTXEN.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for TX transfers.

EPRXEN.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for RX transfers.

EPCTLDIS.description: This bit, when set, disables control (SETUP) transfers

RETRYDIS.description: This is a Host mode only bit and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only

HOSTWOHUB.description: This is a Host mode only field and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only

PDE.description: Enables the weak pulldowns on the USB transceiver.

SUSP.description: Places the USB transceiver into the suspend state.

DMPD.description: Provides observability of the D- Pulldown signal output from the USB OTG module

DPPD.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pulldown . signal output from the USB OTG module

DPPU.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pullup . signal output from the USB OTG module

DPPULLUPNONOTG.description: Provides control of the DP Pullup in the USB OTG module, if USB is configured in non-OTG device mode

SPTEF.description: SPI Transmit Buffer Empty Flag (when FIFO is not supported or not enabled) or SPI transmit FIFO empty flag (when FIFO is supported and enabled)

SPRF.description: SPI Read Buffer Full Flag (when FIFO is not supported or not enabled) or SPI read FIFO FULL flag (when FIFO is supported and enabled)

SPIE.description: SPI Interrupt Enable: for SPRF and MODF (when FIFO is not supported or not enabled) or for read FIFO (when FIFO is supported and enabled)

LVDSC1.description: Low Voltage Detect Status And Control 1 register

LVDSC2.description: Low Voltage Detect Status And Control 2 register

PMSTAT.description: When debug is enabled, the PMSTAT will not update to STOP or VLPS When a PSTOP mode is enabled, the PMSTAT will not update to STOP or VLPS

RSTFLTSRW.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Run and Wait Modes

RSTFLTSS.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Stop Mode

RSTFLTSEL.description: Reset Pin Filter Bus Clock Select

WRAP.description: This field is set to 1 automatically when the POINTER value wraps as determined by the MTB_MASTER[MASK] field in the MASTER Trace Control Register

AUTOSTOP.description: If this field is 1 and WATERMARK is equal to MTB_POSITION[POINTER], then MTB_MASTER[EN] is automatically set to 0

AUTOHALT.description: If this field is 1 and WATERMARK is equal to MTB_POSITION[POINTER], then MTB_MASTER[HALTREQ] is automatically set to 1

BASEADDR.description: This value is defined with a hardwired signal and the expression: 0x2000_0000 - (RAM_Size/4)

BIT2.description: Connected to NIDEN or DBGEN signal.

PERIPHID.description: Peripheral ID4 is hardwired to 0x0000_0004; ID0 to 0x0000_0032; ID1 to 0x0000_00B9; ID2 to 0x0000_000B; and all the others to 0x0000_0000
Peripheral ID1 is hardwired to 0x0000_00E0; ID2 to 0x0000_0008; and all the others to 0x0000_0000.
Peripheral ID1 is hardwired to 0x0000_00E0; ID2 to 0x0000_0008; and all the others to 0x0000_0000.

ASC.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

AMC.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.
